canonical_explanation.text: Our body has many parts that help us do different things. We have eyes to see, ears to hear, a nose to smell, a tongue to taste, and skin to feel. These are our five senses. We must take good care of our body by keeping it clean every day.
rules: Our body has many parts like head, hands, legs, eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.
We have five senses: seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, and touching.
Eyes help us see, ears help us hear, nose helps us smell.
Tongue helps us taste food, skin helps us feel things.
We must keep our body clean by washing hands, brushing teeth, and bathing daily.

questions.question_text: Which body part do we use to see?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our eyes to see things around us. Eyes are the sense organ for sight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ears are for hearing, nose is for smelling, and mouth is for eating and talking. We use our eyes to see things around us.

questions.question_text: Which body part do we use to hear sounds?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our ears to hear sounds. Our ears help us listen to people talking, music, birds singing, and other sounds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eyes are for seeing, nose is for smelling, and tongue is for tasting. Our ears are the body part we use to hear sounds around us.

questions.question_text: How many senses do we have?
questions.explanation_correct: We have 5 senses: sight, hearing, smell, taste, and touch. These five senses help us know the world around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not have 3, 4, or 6 senses. We have exactly 5 senses: sight (eyes), hearing (ears), smell (nose), taste (tongue), and touch (skin).

questions.question_text: Which body part helps us smell flowers?
questions.explanation_correct: Our nose helps us smell flowers. The nose is the sense organ for the sense of smell.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eyes help us see, ears help us hear, and hands help us hold things. Our nose is the body part that helps us smell flowers and other things.

questions.question_text: Which body part helps us taste food?
questions.explanation_correct: The tongue helps us taste food. Our tongue can tell us if food is sweet, sour, salty, or bitter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nose is for smelling, ears are for hearing, and eyes are for seeing. The tongue is the body part that helps us taste food.

questions.question_text: What do we use our legs for?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our legs to walk and run. Our legs help us move from one place to another.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We use our eyes to see, ears to hear, and nose to smell. Our legs are for walking, running, jumping, and moving around.

questions.question_text: What do we use our hands for?

options.text: To hold and pick up things

questions.explanation_correct: We use our hands to hold and pick up things. Our hands help us write, eat, play, and do many activities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We use our legs to walk, ears to hear, and nose to smell. Our hands are for holding, picking up things, writing, and doing many other activities.

questions.question_text: Which sense do we use to feel if something is hot or cold?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our sense of touch to feel if something is hot or cold. Our skin helps us feel temperature.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sight is for seeing, hearing is for listening, and smell is for smelling things. The sense of touch, through our skin, helps us feel if something is hot, cold, soft, or rough.

questions.question_text: How many eyes do we have?
questions.explanation_correct: We have 2 eyes. They are on our face and help us see the world around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not have 1, 3, or 4 eyes. Every person has 2 eyes on their face that help them see.

questions.question_text: How many ears do we have?
questions.explanation_correct: We have 2 ears, one on each side of our head. They help us hear sounds from all around.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not have 1, 3, or 4 ears. We have 2 ears, one on the left side and one on the right side of our head.

questions.question_text: What should we do to keep our teeth clean?
questions.explanation_correct: We should brush our teeth with toothpaste to keep them clean. Brushing removes germs and keeps our teeth healthy and strong.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Just washing with water is not enough to clean teeth. Doing nothing or eating more sweets will make teeth dirty and unhealthy. Brushing with toothpaste is the best way to keep teeth clean.

questions.question_text: How often should we take a bath?
questions.explanation_correct: We should take a bath every day to keep our body clean and fresh. Bathing removes dirt and germs from our skin.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bathing once a week or once a month is not enough. Never bathing will make our body very dirty. We should bath every day to stay clean and healthy.

questions.question_text: Priya closed her eyes. Which sense can she NOT use now?
questions.explanation_correct: When Priya closed her eyes, she cannot use her sense of sight. We need our eyes to be open to see things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Priya can still hear, smell, and feel things with her eyes closed. She cannot see because her eyes are closed. Sight needs open eyes to work.

questions.question_text: You want to know if your dal is too hot. Which sense will you use?
questions.explanation_correct: You will use your sense of touch to feel if the dal is too hot. Your skin and hands can feel the temperature of things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cannot know the temperature of dal by looking at it, listening to it, or smelling it. We use our sense of touch (our skin) to feel if something is hot or cold.

questions.question_text: Which sense helps you know that a jasmine flower smells nice?
questions.explanation_correct: The sense of smell helps you know that a jasmine flower smells nice. Our nose is the sense organ that lets us smell things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sight is for seeing, taste is for tasting food, and hearing is for listening to sounds. The sense of smell, using our nose, helps us know that a jasmine flower has a nice smell.

questions.question_text: To kick a football, which body part do you use?
questions.explanation_correct: To kick a football, we use our legs. Our legs are strong and help us kick the ball far.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not use our hands, head, or ears to kick a football. We use our legs and feet to kick a ball.

questions.question_text: To clap in class, which body part do you use?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our hands to clap. When we bring both hands together, it makes a clapping sound.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cannot clap with our legs, nose, or mouth. We use our hands to clap by bringing them together to make a sound.

questions.question_text: Which sense tells you that a bell is ringing?
questions.explanation_correct: The sense of hearing tells you that a bell is ringing. Our ears help us hear the sound of the bell.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sight is for seeing, taste is for tasting, and touch is for feeling. Hearing is the sense that helps us know a bell is ringing because our ears detect the sound.

questions.question_text: Which body part is on top of our body?
questions.explanation_correct: The head is on the top of our body. Our head has our eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Legs are at the bottom, hands are in the middle, and stomach is in the front. The head is the part that is on top of our body.

questions.question_text: How many fingers do we have on one hand?
questions.explanation_correct: We have 5 fingers on each hand. Count them: thumb, index finger, middle finger, ring finger, and little finger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not have 3, 4, or 6 fingers on one hand. We have exactly 5 fingers on each of our hands.

questions.question_text: When should we wash our hands?
questions.explanation_correct: We should wash our hands before eating food. This removes germs and dirt so we stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should not skip washing hands. Washing only at night or only on Sunday is not enough. We should always wash our hands before eating food and after using the washroom.

questions.question_text: Which sense tells you that a mango is sweet?
questions.explanation_correct: The sense of taste tells you that a mango is sweet. Our tongue can feel the sweet taste when we eat a mango.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smell tells us how something smells, touch tells us how something feels, and hearing tells us about sounds. The sense of taste, using our tongue, tells us that a mango is sweet.

questions.question_text: Which body part helps us feel if a teddy bear is soft?
questions.explanation_correct: Our skin helps us feel if a teddy bear is soft. When we touch the teddy bear, our skin tells us it is soft.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eyes are for seeing, ears are for hearing, and nose is for smelling. Our skin is the body part that helps us feel if something is soft, hard, rough, or smooth.

questions.question_text: Where is the nose on our face?
questions.explanation_correct: The nose is between the eyes and the mouth on our face. It is right in the middle of our face.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nose is not above the eyes, below the mouth, or behind the ears. It is in the centre of our face, between our eyes and our mouth.

questions.question_text: To wave goodbye, which body part do you use?
questions.explanation_correct: To wave goodbye, we use our hand. We raise our hand and move it side to side to say goodbye.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not wave goodbye with our legs, ears, or nose. We use our hand to wave at someone when we say goodbye.

questions.question_text: What should we do to keep our hair neat?
questions.explanation_correct: We should comb our hair to keep it neat and tidy. Combing helps to untangle and smooth our hair.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Never touching our hair or leaving it messy will make it tangled. Cutting it every day is not needed. We should comb our hair every day to keep it neat.

questions.question_text: Why should we keep our nails short?
questions.explanation_correct: We should keep our nails short to keep germs away. Long nails can collect dirt and germs that can make us sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping nails short is not just about looking pretty or following instructions. It is important because short nails do not collect dirt and germs, so we stay healthy.

questions.question_text: Which body part is used for eating food?
questions.explanation_correct: The mouth is used for eating food. Our mouth has teeth to chew food and a tongue to taste it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eyes are for seeing, ears are for hearing, and nose is for smelling. The mouth is the body part we use to eat food.

questions.question_text: To nod yes, which body part do you move?
questions.explanation_correct: To nod yes, we move our head up and down. This is how we show that we agree or say yes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not move our hands, legs, or fingers to nod yes. We move our head up and down to show we agree.

questions.question_text: Which sense do you use to read a book?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our sense of sight to read a book. Our eyes help us see and read the words and pictures in a book.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not use hearing, smell, or taste to read a book. We use our eyes and the sense of sight to see the letters and pictures in a book.

questions.question_text: We have two eyes.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we have two eyes. Both eyes are on our face and they help us see the world.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. We have two eyes, one on each side of our nose, and they help us see things around us.

questions.question_text: We have three ears.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We have two ears, not three. One ear is on each side of our head.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not have three ears. We have only two ears, one on the left side and one on the right side of our head.

questions.question_text: We use our nose to hear sounds.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We use our nose to smell, not to hear. We use our ears to hear sounds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nose is for smelling, not for hearing. Our ears are the body part we use to hear sounds.

questions.question_text: The tongue helps us taste food.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the tongue helps us taste food. Our tongue can tell us if food is sweet, sour, salty, or bitter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. The tongue is the body part that helps us taste different foods and their flavours.

questions.question_text: We should brush our teeth every day.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we should brush our teeth every day. Brushing keeps our teeth clean and healthy and prevents cavities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Brushing teeth daily is important to remove food and germs and keep our teeth strong and healthy.

questions.question_text: We should never wash our hands.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We should wash our hands often, especially before eating and after playing. Washing hands removes germs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We must wash our hands regularly. Not washing hands lets germs stay on them, which can make us sick when we eat.

questions.question_text: We use our legs to walk.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we use our legs to walk. Our legs help us move, run, and jump.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Our legs are the body parts that help us walk, run, and move around.

questions.question_text: We use our ears to hold things.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We use our ears to hear sounds, not to hold things. We use our hands to hold things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ears are for hearing, not holding. We use our hands and fingers to hold and carry things.

questions.question_text: Our skin helps us feel things.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, our skin helps us feel things. It tells us if something is hot, cold, soft, hard, rough, or smooth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Our skin is the sense organ for touch. It helps us feel temperature and texture of things.

questions.question_text: Arjun covered his ears with his hands. What can he NOT do now?
questions.explanation_correct: When Arjun covers his ears, he cannot hear clearly. Covering ears blocks the sound from reaching them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Arjun can still see, smell, and touch even with his ears covered. He cannot hear clearly because his ears are covered and sounds are blocked.

questions.question_text: Which body part do we use to talk?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our mouth to talk. Our mouth, tongue, and lips all work together to make words and sounds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eyes are for seeing, hands are for holding, and legs are for walking. We use our mouth to talk and say words.

questions.question_text: Meera wants to find out if the lemon water is sour. Which sense organ should she use?
questions.explanation_correct: Meera should use her tongue to find out if the lemon water is sour. The tongue is the sense organ for taste and it can detect sour, sweet, salty, and bitter tastes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eyes can see the lemon water but cannot tell if it is sour. Nose can smell it, and hands can feel if it is cold or warm. Only the tongue can tell us if something tastes sour.

questions.question_text: Why should we take a bath every day?
questions.explanation_correct: We take a bath every day to keep our body clean. Bathing removes dirt, sweat, and germs from our skin and keeps us healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not take a bath just to play in water or to get wet. We bathe every day to keep our body clean and to wash away dirt and germs.

questions.question_text: Ravi is in a dark room. He can hear his mother calling. Which sense is he using?
questions.explanation_correct: Ravi is using his sense of hearing. Even in a dark room, he can hear his mother calling because ears do not need light to work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a dark room, Ravi cannot see, so he is not using sight. He is not touching or tasting anything. He is using his sense of hearing because his ears can pick up the sound of his mother calling.

questions.question_text: The head is at the bottom of our body.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. The head is at the top of our body, not the bottom. Our feet are at the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The head is not at the bottom. The head is at the very top of our body. Our legs and feet are at the bottom.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a good hygiene habit?
questions.explanation_correct: Washing hands before meals is a good hygiene habit. It removes germs from our hands so they do not enter our body when we eat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating with dirty hands, not brushing teeth, and wearing dirty clothes are all bad habits. They can make us sick. Washing hands before meals is the good hygiene habit.

questions.question_text: To write your name, which body part do you use?
questions.explanation_correct: To write your name, you use your hand. Your hand holds the pencil and moves it to form letters.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not write with our legs, ears, or nose. We use our hand to hold a pencil and write our name and other things.

questions.question_text: We can taste food with our eyes.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We cannot taste food with our eyes. We taste food with our tongue. Eyes are for seeing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eyes are for seeing, not tasting. The tongue is the body part that helps us taste food and feel its flavour.

questions.question_text: Anita played in the mud. What should she do first when she comes home?
questions.explanation_correct: Anita should wash her hands and feet first when she comes home after playing in mud. This removes the dirt and germs from her body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating snacks with dirty hands, watching TV, or sleeping while dirty are not good ideas. After playing in mud, Anita should first wash her hands and feet to remove dirt and germs.

questions.question_text: Which TWO senses does Rohan use when he eats a gulab jamun?
questions.explanation_correct: When Rohan eats a gulab jamun, he uses taste (tongue) to feel the sweet taste and smell (nose) to enjoy its nice smell. Both senses work together when we eat food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While eating, sight and hearing are not the main senses used. Touch and hearing do not help us enjoy food's flavour. When we eat a gulab jamun, we mainly use our sense of taste and smell together.
